title: Smoked Mackerel & Egg Breakfast Bowl
description: A savory, protein-packed breakfast bowl combining flaky smoked mackerel, soft-boiled eggs, and bright lemon-herb dressing over crunchy greens and tender new potatoes. Quick to assemble with bold smoky, briny, and citrus notes for a satisfying morning meal.

ingredients.display_name: smoked mackerel fillets, skin removed and flaked
ingredients.notes: scale or flake into bite-sized pieces; remove skin if desired

ingredients.display_name: new potatoes, halved or quartered depending on size
mixed salad greens (arugula, baby spinach, or mixed leaves)

ingredients.notes: soak in cold water 5 minutes if you want milder flavor
adjust to taste and account for salted mackerel
adds color and extra smoky aroma

steps.text: Bring a medium saucepan of salted water to a rolling simmer and add the new potatoes. Cook until tender when pierced with a knife, about 12-14 minutes depending on size; drain and set aside to cool slightly.

While potatoes cook, bring another small saucepan of water to a gentle boil for eggs; lower in the eggs carefully and cook for 6 minutes for soft-boiled yolks. Immediately transfer eggs to an ice bath and cool for 2 minutes before peeling.
Prepare the dressing by whisking together lemon juice, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt, and pepper until emulsified; taste and adjust acidity or seasoning as desired.

Flake the smoked mackerel into large pieces, removing any bones, and combine with chopped parsley, capers (if using), and thinly sliced red onion in a bowl; toss gently with a small amount of the dressing to coat.

Divide mixed greens between bowls, add halved or quartered warm potatoes, top with flaked mackerel mixture, and place two peeled soft-boiled eggs halved on each bowl. Drizzle remaining dressing over the bowls and finish with a sprinkle of smoked paprika and extra black pepper.
